SEARCH
Module org.jnetpcap
Package org.jnetpcap

Interface PcapHeader

public sealed interface PcapHeader
PcapHeader relies on preview features of the Java platform:
  • PcapHeader refers to one or more preview APIs: Addressable, MemorySegment, MemorySession.
Programs can only use PcapHeader when preview features are enabled.
Preview features may be removed in a future release, or upgraded to permanent features of the Java platform.
The pcap header which describes how many bytes of a packet were seen on the network, how many were actually captured and the capture timestamp.
Author:
Sly Technologies Inc, repos@slytechs.com, mark

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    PCAP_HEADER_LENGTH
    The normal header length is 16 bytes.
    static final int
    PCAP_HEADER_PADDED_LENGTH
    The padded header length can be up to 24 bytes.

  • Field Details

    • PCAP_HEADER_LENGTH

      static final int PCAP_HEADER_LENGTH
      The normal header length is 16 bytes. This is when all of the pcap header structure fields are compacted or one 32-bit system.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • PCAP_HEADER_PADDED_LENGTH

      static final int PCAP_HEADER_PADDED_LENGTH
      The padded header length can be up to 24 bytes. This is when tv_sec and tv_usec fields are padded to 8 bytes each instead of 4 bytes of actual field sizes. When allocating native memory to hold a header, it is safer and recommended to use the padded length.

  • Method Details

    • allocate

      static PcapHeader allocate(int length, MemorySessionPREVIEW scope)
      Allocates a new PcapHeader in native memory. Current, low resolution time source is used to estimate the tvSec and tvUsec values.
      Parameters:
      length - the length of the packet in bytes, used to initialize both wireLength and captureLength fields.
      scope - for memory allocation
      Returns:
      new native memory backed pcap header

    • allocate

      static PcapHeader allocate(MemorySessionPREVIEW scope)
      Allocates a new PcapHeader in native memory. All fields are uninitialized and may not be zeroed out, depending on the constants of the native memory.
      Parameters:
      scope - for memory allocation
      Returns:
      new native memory backed pcap header

    • newInstance

      static PcapHeader newInstance(AddressablePREVIEW src)
      Creates a new writable instance of the pcap header. The header field values are copied from the memory into this header. Byte ordering defaults to native byte order.
      Parameters:
      src - the src
      Returns:
      new pcap header

    • newInstance

      static PcapHeader newInstance(AddressablePREVIEW src, ByteOrder order)
      Creates a new writable instance of the pcap header. The header field values are copied from the memory into this header. Byte ordering defaults to native byte order.
      Parameters:
      src - the src
      order - byte ordering
      Returns:
      new pcap header

    • newInstance

      static PcapHeader newInstance(long tvSec, long tvUsec, int caplen, int wirelen)
      Creates a new writable instance of the pcap header. The header field values are copied from the memory into this header using native byte ordering.
      Parameters:
      tvSec - the tv sec epoch time in seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am
      tvUsec - the tv usec micro or nano second fraction of a second
      caplen - the caplen how much data was captured
      wirelen - the wirelen actual packet length as seen on the wire
      Returns:
      new pcap header

    • newInstance

      static PcapHeader newInstance(long tvSec, long tvUsec, int caplen, int wirelen, ByteOrder order)
      Creates a new writable instance of the pcap header. The header field values are copied from the memory into this header using the provided byte ordering.
      Parameters:
      tvSec - the tv sec epoch time in seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am
      tvUsec - the tv usec micro or nano second fraction of a second
      caplen - the caplen how much data was captured
      wirelen - the wirelen actual packet length as seen on the wire
      order - byte ordering
      Returns:
      new pcap header

    • newReadOnlyInstance

      static PcapHeader newReadOnlyInstance(AddressablePREVIEW src)
      Creates a new fast read only instance of the pcap header. The header field values are copied from the memory into this header. Byte ordering defaults to native byte order.
      Parameters:
      src - memory source where native pcap header is found
      Returns:
      new pcap header

    • newReadOnlyInstance

      static PcapHeader newReadOnlyInstance(AddressablePREVIEW src, ByteOrder order)
      Creates a new fast read only instance of the pcap header. The header field values are copied from the memory into this header using the provided byte ordering.
      Parameters:
      src - memory source where native pcap header is found
      order - byte order of the native memory segment
      Returns:
      new pcap header

    • newReadOnlyInstance

      static PcapHeader newReadOnlyInstance(long tvSec, long tvUsec, int caplen, int wirelen, ByteOrder order)
      Creates a new fast read only instance of the pcap header. The header field values are copied from the memory into this header using the specified byte ordering.
      Parameters:
      tvSec - the tv sec epoch time in seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am
      tvUsec - the tv usec micro or nano second fraction of a second
      caplen - the caplen how much data was captured
      wirelen - the wirelen actual packet length as seen on the wire
      order - byte ordering
      Returns:
      new pcap header

    • ofAddress

      static PcapHeader ofAddress(AddressablePREVIEW addressable)
      Wraps a header instance around the provided memory object. If addressable is a MemorySegment it will be wrapped directly. If the addressible is a MemoryAddress, a new MemorySegment will be created and wrapped around the address.
      Parameters:
      addressable - native memory address or segment at the start of the pcap structure in native memory
      Returns:
      new PcapHeader instance

    • ofArray

      static PcapHeader ofArray(byte[] arr)
      Creates a no-copy, Pcap header that wraps around the byte array. The integer byte ordering is assumed to be ByteOrder.nativeOrder().
      Parameters:
      arr - the arr
      Returns:
      the new pcap header

    • ofArray

      static PcapHeader ofArray(byte[] arr, int offset)
      Creates a no-copy, Pcap header that wraps around the byte array. The integer byte ordering is assumed to be ByteOrder.nativeOrder().
      Parameters:
      arr - the byte array containing the header data at a specific offset
      offset - the offset in to arr where the header start
      Returns:
      the new pcap header

      static PcapHeader ofBuffer(ByteBuffer buffer)
      Of buffer.
      Parameters:
      buffer - the buffer
      Returns:
      the pcap header

      static int readCaptureLength(AddressablePREVIEW memory)
      Reads the captureLength field value from the memory object.
      Parameters:
      memory - the memory
      Returns:
      number of bytes captured, possibly truncated

    • readTvSec

      static long readTvSec(AddressablePREVIEW memory)
      Reads the tvSec field value from the memory object.
      Parameters:
      memory - the memory
      Returns:
      number of seconds from the start of epoch time, Jan 1st 1970 12:00am.

    • readTvUsec

      static long readTvUsec(AddressablePREVIEW memory)
      Reads the tvUsec field value from the memory object.
      Parameters:
      memory - the memory
      Returns:
      faction of a second either in nanos or micros depending the capture source

      static int readWireLength(AddressablePREVIEW memory)
      Reads the wireLength field value from the memory object.
      Parameters:
      memory - the memory
      Returns:
      number of bytes in the original packet seen on the wire

    • write

      static int write(long tvSec, long tvUsec, int caplen, int wirelen, AddressablePREVIEW dst, ByteOrder order)
      Writes values directly into native memory.
      Parameters:
      tvSec - the tv sec epoch time in seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am
      tvUsec - the tv usec micro or nano second fraction of a second
      caplen - the caplen how much data was captured
      wirelen - the wirelen actual packet length as seen on the wire
      dst - dst could be a memory address or a memory segment, either of which is acceptable
      order - the endianness of the values to be written
      Returns:
      the int

    • write

      static int write(long tvSec, long tvUsec, int caplen, int wirelen, byte[] dst, int offset, ByteOrder order)
      Writes values directly into the destination byte array at specified offset.
      Parameters:
      tvSec - the tv sec epoch time in seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am
      tvUsec - the tv usec micro or nano second fraction of a second
      caplen - the caplen how much data was captured
      wirelen - the wirelen actual packet length as seen on the wire
      dst - the byte array to write to
      offset - the offset in to dst array
      order - the endianness of the values to be written
      Returns:
      the int

    • write

      static int write(long tvSec, long tvUsec, int caplen, int wirelen, ByteBuffer dst)
      Writes values directly into the destination buffer.
      Parameters:
      tvSec - the tv sec epoch time in seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am
      tvUsec - the tv usec micro or nano second fraction of a second
      caplen - the caplen how much data was captured
      wirelen - the wirelen actual packet length as seen on the wire
      dst - the byte array to write to at current buffers position
      Returns:
      the int

    • asMemoryReference

      AddressablePREVIEW asMemoryReference()
      Returns a memory address of this pcap header as addressable, suitable for use in native downcall functions. An addressable keeps any backing memory segments, arrays or buffers reachable. If implementating header is non-memory based, a new memory segment will be allocated and its address returned.

      Note, that if this header instance is backed by native memory, the backing native memory segment will be returned. If the header instance is non-memory based, a new native memory segment will be allocated and values of this header copied into it. Therefore if pcap header is be to used natively, it is more efficient to wrap and instance around a memory segment using one of the ofAddress(Addressable)PREVIEW factory methods.

      Returns:
      the memory segment containing this header's field values

    • asReadOnly

      PcapHeader asReadOnly()
      Returns a read-only version of the pcap header.
      Returns:
      the pcap header

    • captureLength

      int captureLength()
      Number of packet bytes actually captured, up to maximum length of 'snaplen' if set on a capture. Only 16-bits LSB are significant.
      Returns:
      actual number of bytes captured

    • copyTo

      default int copyTo(byte[] dst, int offset)
      Copies this header's contents to the destination byte array at specific offset. The values of this pcap header are copied into the array compacted (no padding).
      Parameters:
      dst - the destination byte array
      offset - the offset in to the byte array
      Returns:
      number of bytes copied which should be 16 non non-padded header length

    • copyTo

      default int copyTo(ByteBuffer dst)
      Copies this header's contents to the destination buffer starting at the buffer's position. The buffer's position is not advanced. The values of this pcap header are copied into the buffer compacted (no padding).
      Parameters:
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      number of bytes copied which should be 16 non non-padded header length

    • copyTo

      int copyTo(MemorySegmentPREVIEW dst)
      Copies this header's contents to the destination memory segment. Values are copied into the memory segment with ABI padding, if any and using the byte ordering of this header.
      Parameters:
      dst - the destination memory segment
      Returns:
      the number of byte written to memory, on certain systems (i.e. 64-bit) the number may reflected padding as well and should be the same value as 24.

    • isReadOnly

      boolean isReadOnly()
      Checks if the header is read only.
      Returns:
      true, if is read only

    • order

      ByteOrder order()
      Byte ordering of the values of this header.
      Returns:
      endianness of the pcap header

    • order

      PcapHeader order(ByteOrder newOrder)
      changes the byte order of values are read from this pcap header.
      Parameters:
      newOrder - the new byte order
      Returns:
      this pcap header

    • set

      default PcapHeader set(int length)
      Sets new header values by estimating the tvSec and tvUsec values using a current low resolution time source and setting both captureLength and wireLength fields to length.
      Parameters:
      length - packet length in bytes
      Returns:
      this pcap header

    • set

      default PcapHeader set(int caplen, int wirelen)
      Sets new header values by estimating the tvSec and tvUsec values using a current low resolution time source.
      Parameters:
      caplen - number of bytes captured
      wirelen - number of bytes in the packet on the wire
      Returns:
      this pcap header

    • set

      PcapHeader set(long tvSec, long tvUsec, int caplen, int wirelen)
      Sets new header values.
      Parameters:
      tvSec - set the tvSec field or number of seconds since start of epoch, Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am
      tvUsec - set the tvUsec field or fraction of a second in micros or nanos
      caplen - number of bytes captured
      wirelen - number of bytes in the packet on the wire
      Returns:
      this pcap header

    • toEpochMicro

      default long toEpochMicro()
      Converts the tvSec() and tvUsec() values into a epoch microsecond value.
      Returns:
      Number of microseconds since epoch start, Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am.

    • toEpochMilli

      default long toEpochMilli()
      Converts the tvSec() and tvUsec() values into a epoch millisecond value, compatible with java Date class and java.time package. The method uses the default PcapTStampPrecision.TSTAMP_PRECISION_MICRO precision value for tvUsec() field.
      Returns:
      Number of milliseconds since epoch start, Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am.

    • toEpochTime

      default long toEpochTime(PcapTStampPrecision precision)
      Converts the tvSec() and tvUsec() values into a epoch time of provided precision.
      Parameters:
      precision - the precision of tvUsec() field and how it is interpreted
      Returns:
      Number of micro or nano seconds since epoch start, Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am, depending on the precision argument

    • tvSec

      long tvSec()
      Pcap timestamp seconds value within pcap header. The value is an epoch or unix time, which is number of seconds since Jan 1, 1970 at 12:00am. Only 32-bits LSB are significant.
      Returns:
      Number of seconds since epoch start (Jan 1st, 1970 12:00am)

    • tvUsec

      long tvUsec()
      A fraction of a second, by default in micro-seconds but may also be in nanoseconds depending on the capture device or how the timestamp was stored in a 'savefile'. Only 32-bits LSB are significant.
      Returns:
      fraction of a second in micros or nanos

    • wireLength

      int wireLength()
      Original packet length in bytes as seen on the wire. This can be different from captureLength() value, as packets can be captured truncated resulting in smaller packet capture size. Only 16-bits LSB are significant.
      Returns:
      the length of a packet in bytes as seen on the wire before any truncation, if any
